text: Hi, my name is Ian Cottingham

and I lead the AWS
Outposts Engineering Team.
We first launched Outposts in 2019
to support customer workloads that needed
to stay on premises

or at the edge to meet
low latency, data residency
and local data processing needs.

It's incredible to see how
customers are using Outposts

in so many different
ways. Running everything
for multiplayer games and manufacturing

control systems,
to healthcare applications

and payment systems right
in their own data centers.

We're excited to introduce
the second generation of

Outpost racks, which delivers
even greater performance

for a broader range of
on-premises workloads
and some of the most demanding workloads
that were previously considered
impossible to run in the cloud.

In this video, I wanted to break
down the latest innovations

inside this new generation
of Outpost racks.

First, the new Outpost racks
support the latest generation
of Amazon EC2 instances, starting

with general purpose M7i
instances
compute optimized C7i instances
and memory optimized R7i instances.
Compared to M5, C5 and R5 on the
previous generation of Outpost racks,

these instances deliver
twice the vCPU, memory and

network bandwidth and up
to 40% performance improvement.
We've also revolutionized networking
with this generation of Outpost rack.

The new network rack acts
as an aggregation layer

for all compute and
storage racks, allowing you
to scale your compute
and networking capacity independently
for demanding workloads.

The network rack comes
with built-in resiliency

to handle switch failures,
making it easier for you
to architect high availability.

Also available on the
new generation of Outpost

racks is a new category
of Amazon EC2 instances
with accelerated networking, designed

for the most latency
sensitive, compute intensive

and throughput intensive
workloads on premises.

These instances feature
specialized network accelerator

cards directly connected to
high speed top-of-rack switches,

ideally suited for on-premises
workloads with low latency
and high throughput requirements such

as financial exchanges, real-time
market data distribution,
telecom 5G core, and media distribution.
It's interesting to highlight

that Bmn-sf2e instances
are connected to top

of rack switches with
equal length cabling,

helping financial services
customers meet stringent

regulatory requirements on
fair trading and equal access.

All these instances are built
on the same AWS Nitro System

that powers modern EC2
instances in the AWS

regions today, extending
the same performance

and security benefits to
on-premises locations.

You can leverage the same
APIs, management console,
automation, governance policies

and security controls for
all of your applications,

whether they are in AWS regions
or on-premises locations.

This allows you to centralize
infrastructure management
and streamline developer workflow

by standardizing on a common
set of CI/CD pipelines.
With the new generation of Outpost racks,

you can run the most demanding
workloads on premises
to meet performance requirements

and seamlessly connect
to advanced analytics
and AI/ML services in the AWS regions
to accelerate business innovation
and improve operational efficiency.

We are incredibly excited to
see what our customers can do

with this technology and look
forward to working with you

to bring the AWS experience
wherever you need it.
